content.description: Use the table to answer the question.
content.question: Disposable Income Consumption Spending <math alttext="$10,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></math> <math alttext="$6,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>6</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></math> <math alttext="$11,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$11</mtext><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$6,600" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>6</mn><mtext>,6</mtext><mn>00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Using the disposable income and consumption data in the table above, calculate the value of the marginal propensity to consume <math alttext="open parenthesis, M P C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(MPC)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and the marginal propensity to save <math alttext="open parenthesis, M P S, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(MPS)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

choices.label: <math alttext="M P C equals 0.04, M P S equals 0.96" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPC</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.04</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> </mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext>MPS</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.96</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M P C equals 0.10, M P S equals 0.90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPC</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mtext>MPS</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M P C equals 0.2, M P S equals 0.80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPC</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext>MPS</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M P C equals 0.50, M P S equals 0.50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPC</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.50</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext>MPS</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M P C equals 0.60, M P S equals 0.40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPC</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.60</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext>MPS</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
